metadata:
Western Association of Fish and Wildlife Agencies; National Sage-grouse Conservation Planning Framework Team Unpublished Material Ordination of major sagebrush taxa in the Intermountain Region The table containing information pertaining to sagebrush species and soil temperature and soil moisture gradients can be found in Table 5.1, Chapter 5, p. 5-24, in Connelly, J. W., S. T. Knick, M. A. Schroeder, and S. J. Stiver. 2004. Conservation assessment of Greater Sage-grouse and sagebrush habitats. Western Association of Fish and Wildlife Agencies. Unpublished Report. Cheyenne, Wyoming. http://sagemap.wr.usgs.gov/FTP/regional/USGS/Fig_5.1_sgca.pdf http://srfs.wr.usgs.gov/Fresc_ScienceData/fig_5_1.zip https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/542dabf2e4b092f17defca58
Schematic displaying the major sagebrush species against soil temperature and soil moisture gradients. It is a portion of chapter 5: Sagebrush Ecosystems: Dynamics of Primary Sagebrush Habitats in the larger document: Conservation and Assessment of Greater sage-grouse and Sagebrush Habitat. Western Associations of Fish and Wildlife Agencies. 2004. To supply a visualization of the soil temperature and soil moisture gradients against the major sagebrush species. Where along these two gradients do particular species of sagebrush exist.
2004
publication date
Complete As needed
-123.73288 -102.269813 49.999432 35.723732
REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords. Ecosystems Vegetation Sagebrush Soil Gradient
Sagebrush Biome

NA complete
Figure was adapted for use in the Sagebrush Ecosystems chapter (chp. 5) from West and Young, 2002. Additions were made by the authors from Robertson et al. 1966 and McArthur, 1983. Further, sagebrush ordinance along elevation, slope, salinity and precipitation gradients were determined from field samples collected throughout the biome. 20040515

Users are cautioned to consider carefully the provisional nature of these data and information before using them for decisions that concern personal or public safety or the conduct of business that involves substantial monetary or operational consequences. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data.
